articles.title: The US keeps cutting large checks to China, Japan and Germany
articles.description: We are now watching Trump's fiscal stimulus leaking out into huge, and growing, wealth transfers to China, Japan and Germany — a devastating and totally predictable result of an ineffective trade policy, Michael Ivanovitch writes.
articles.content: It would, therefore, seem reasonable to temper a sudden enthusiasm that Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will solve the trade issue during the G-20 meeting in Buenos Aires, Argentina, that starts Nov. 30. There are a number of things to consider. First,… [+2152 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Oil prices fall as US grants Iran sanction waivers to 8 importers
articles.description: The United States said on Friday it will temporarily allow eight importers to keep buying Iranian oil when it re-imposes sanctions, aimed at forcing Iran to curb its nuclear, missile and regional activities.
articles.content: Oil prices fell on Monday as the start to U.S. sanctions against Iran's fuel exports was softened by waivers that will allow some countries to still import Iranian crude, at least temporarily. Front-month Brent crude futures were at $72.39 per barrel at 0142 … [+2377 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Bank of Japan governor says he's aware that easy policy is hurting lenders, warns of global risks
articles.description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said on Monday the central bank was aware that prolonged ultra-loose monetary policy could squeeze financial institutions' margins and potentially destabilize the country's banking system.
articles.content: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said on Monday the central bank was aware that prolonged ultra-loose monetary policy could squeeze financial institutions' margins and potentially destabilize the country's banking system. Given subdued inflation and unc… [+2165 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: China's services sector grows at slowest pace in 13 months as orders dry up
articles.description: China's services sector chalked its slowest growth in over a year last month as the volume of new orders dried up, a private survey showed, suggesting a further loss in economic momentum as a rough 2018 draws to a close.
articles.content: China's services sector chalked its slowest growth in over a year last month as the volume of new orders dried up, a private survey showed, suggesting a further loss in economic momentum as a rough 2018 draws to a close. The slowdown in the services sector wh… [+2568 chars]

articles.title: China's Xi again talks up commitment to 'free trade'
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping took to the global stage to repeat his rhetoric against protectionism and promote his country as an advocate for international openness and cooperation.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Sons of slain Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi appeal for the return of his body
articles.description: The sons of slain Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi on Sunday issued an appeal for the return of their father's body and said they wanted to return to Saudi Arabia to bury him.
